author: mikldude
text:
I have the 12 pro max and 14 pro max and a couple of older galaxys , looking at the differences between the 12 and 14 models ,in general day to day use and general performance , i find much as you have shown here Nick , my old 12 pro max still performs like a beauty , and in my own speed test tests between the two , the difference more often than not for general use was imo very small , and i usually have 4 phones a macbook and ipad at my side , and when it comes to the iphones , im just as happy to pick up the 12 pro max as the newer 14 pro max , and i still prefer the notch to the island ..... just personal preference , but i do always carry the 14 whne i go somewhere , and when outside in the sun or in bright day light , the slightly more bright screen of the 14 pro max is a bit of a luxury on the eyes , although the 12 was still quite decent .
Given i dont game on phones , and really dont run them at the limit , i probably could have saved some coin and just stayed with the old fathful 12 PM ...... but wheres the fun in that :) .

author: Ari Jonathan Chandra
text:
Kamis 6 April jam setengah 12 malem nonton video ini, dalem hati cuman mikir "kapan ya bisa punya hp flagship, Tuhan, kalo boleh, pengen deh punya"

Jumat 7 April sepulang gereja habis Jum'at Agung, jam 4 sore ke Central Park, ga tau nya lagi ada event Galaxy Land dan ketika nanya proses trade in, ternyata Samsung A72 ku yang usia nya udah 2 tahun dan dulu aku beli di harga 6,6 juta di hargain in total dengan promo jadi 5,6 buat motong harga Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra, dan karena uda nonton review nya di channel GadgetIn, ga pake pikir panjang, langsung gas, and I think this my best buy of 2023.

Thank you David and GadgetIn Team for producing quality content like this! Oh iya congrats on your new born baby , David!

author: Nitesh Apte
text: If you are more into mobile videography, go for s23 Ultra. But if you are more into photography, s22 Ultra pictures including night mode pictures are much better than s23 Ultra. I own s22 Ultra and recently got s23 Ultra too. After doing image and video comparison, I found s22 Ultra images are less grainy, sharper (less sharp after April update), more clear, basically overall better than s23 Ultra. But in s23 Ultra colours are more accurate, especially skin tones, sky colours, reds are very close to natural colour. The videos are definitely better than s22 Ultra. Surprisingly, shadow areas are grainier in pictures, but video of the same shadow areas has no grains in s23 Ultra. And obviously no grains in s22 Ultra. After April update, selfie video quality has improved a lot in s22 Ultra. So, overall s22 Ultra is more stable in terms of camera performance. Upgrading to s23 Ultra from s22 Ultra is a waste of money unless you are more into mobile videography than photography.

author: Yawning Deer
text: My S23 Ultra doesnt make it the full day. Comes really close, but if you  take a lot of videos and photos and watch a lot of Youtube,   or in general a heavy user, be warned. I generally rate this guy but there are a lot a variables. If he has two phones in his pockets and use both or if he uses only the FHD and 60hz settings, yes I can see why he gets more battery life. Disappointed about the wishy washy style of explaining features like battery life without explaining constraints or references so its a more analytical approach to testing said features.
